entry.title: Orthogonal polynomials in several variables. I
entry.summary: In this paper we introduce and discuss some classes of orthogonal polynomials in several non-commuting variables. The emphasis is on a non-commutative version of the orthogonal polynomials on the real line. We introduce recurrence equations for these polynomials, Christoffel-Darboux formulas, and Jacobi type matrices.

entry.title: On the embedding of nonseparable space lp in Banach spaces with uncountable symmetric bases
entry.summary: This article has a fatal error. It was noted by F. Hernandez. Article replaces with my answer.

entry.title: On Banach spaces with the Tsirelson property
entry.summary: A Banach space X is said to have the Tsirelson property if it does not contain subspaces that are isomorphic to l_{p}, p in [1,infty) or c_{0}. The article contains a quite simple method to producing Banach spaces with the Tsirelson property.

entry.title: k-hyponormality of powers of weighted shifts via Schur products
entry.summary: We characterize $k$-hyponormality and quadratic hyponormality of powers of weighted shifts using Schur product techniques.

entry.title: Stability of some unilateral free-discontinuity problems in two-dimensional domains
entry.summary: The purpose of this paper is to study the stability of some unilateral free-discontinuity problems, under perturbations of the discontinuity sets in the Hausdorff metric.

entry.title: How many operators do there exist on a Banach space?
entry.summary: We present partial results to the following question: Does every infinite dimensional Banach space have an infinite dimensional subspace on which one can define an operator which is not a compact perturbation of a scalar multiplication?

entry.title: On diffeomorphisms deleting weakly compacta in Banach spaces
entry.summary: We prove that if X is an infinite-dimensional Banach space with C^p smooth partitions of unity, then X and X\K are C^p diffeomorphic, for every weakly compact subset K of X.

entry.title: A Survey of Algebraic Extensions of Commutative, Unital Normed Algebras
entry.summary: We describe the role of algebraic extensions in the theory of commutative, unital normed algebras, with special attention to uniform algebras. We shall also compare these constructions and show how they are related to each other.

entry.title: The Berezin Transform on the Toeplitz Algebra
entry.summary: This paper studies the boundary behavior of the Berezin transform on the C*-algebra generated by the analytic Toeplitz operators on the Bergman space.

entry.title: Minimal vectors in arbitrary Banach spaces
entry.summary: We extend the method of minimal vectors to arbitrary Banach spaces. It is proved, by a variant of the method, that certain quasinilpotent operators on arbitrary Banach spaces have hyperinvariant subspaces.
entry.arxiv:comment: 6 pages. To appear in Proc. Amer. Math. Soc

entry.title: Note on Near Subnormal Weighted Shifts
entry.summary: In this note, necessary and sufficient conditions are obtained for unilateral weighted shifts to be near subnormal . As an application of the main results, many answers to the Hilbert space problem 160 are presented at the end of the paper.

entry.title: Spectral Characterization of Hyponormal Weighted Shifts
entry.summary: The complete characterizations of the spectra and their various parts of hyponormal unilateral and bilateral weighted shifts are presented respectively in this paper. The results obtained here generalize the corresponding work of the references.

entry.title: Feynman Diagrams and Wick Products Associated with $q$-Fock spaces
entry.summary: It is shown that if one keeps track of crossings, Feynman diagrams can be used to compute $q$-Wick products and normal products in terms of each other.

entry.title: Generalized Functionals in Gaussian Spaces - The Characterization Theorem Revisited
entry.summary: Gel'fand triples of test and generalized functionals in Gaussian spaces are constructed and characterized.

entry.title: Algebraic Sum of Unbounded Normal Operators and the Square Root Problem of Kato
entry.summary: We prove that the algebraic sum of unbounded normal operators satisfies the square root problem of Kato under appropriate hypotheses. As application, we consider perturbed Schrodinger operators.

entry.title: Tensor Algebras and Displacement Structure. III. Asymptotic properties
entry.summary: We continue to investigate some classes of Szeg\"o type polynomials in several variables. We focus on asymptotic properties of these polynomials and we extend several classical results of G. Szeg\"o to this setting.

entry.title: A remark on absolutely summing multilinear mappings
entry.summary: In this note we obtain new coincidence theorems for absolutely summing multilinear mappings between Banach spaces. We also prove that our results, in general, can not be improved.

entry.title: On the multilinear extensions of the concept of absolutely summing operators
entry.summary: In this paper we investigate the connections between the several different extensions of the concept of absolutely summing operators.

entry.title: On scalar-valued nonlinear absolutely summing mappings
entry.summary: In this note we show that the well known coincidence results for scalar-valued homogeneous polynomials can not be generalized in some natural directions.

entry.title: Hausdorff-Young inequalities for nonunimodular groups
entry.summary: The paper studies Hausdorff-Young inequalities for certain group extensions, by use of Mackey's theory. We consider the case in which the dual action of the quotient group is free almost everywhere. This result applies to yield a Hausdorff-Young inequality for nonunimodular groups.

entry.title: On Banach spaces whose duals are isomorphic to l_1
entry.summary: In this paper we present new characterizations of Banach spaces whose duals are isomorphic to $l_{1}(\Gamma),$ extending results of Stegall, Lewis-Stegall and Cilia-D'Anna-Guti\'{e}rrez.

entry.title: Some Results About Reverses of Cauchy-Schwarz Inequality in Inner Product Spaces
entry.summary: Some new reverses of the Cauchy-Schwarz inequality in inner product spaces are presented in this paper.The results obtained here complement the recent work of the references.

entry.title: A Non-commutative Monotone Selection Principle
entry.summary: We give an elementary proof of a monotone selection principle which allows to pass from increasing nets to increasing sequences in the Hermitian part of a $\sigma$-finite von Neumann algebra. This is to be seen as a ``monotone version'' of first countability.

entry.title: Two Elementary Derivations of the Pure Fisher-Hartwig Determinant
entry.summary: We present two elementary derivations of the formula for the Toeplitz determinant generated by a pure Fisher-Hartwig singularity.
entry.arxiv:comment: LaTeX, 4 pages. This replaces a version with one proof

entry.title: A Note on Near Subnormal Weighted Shifts
entry.summary: A complete characterization of near subnormality for bilateral weighted shifts is obtained. As an application of the main results, many new answers to the Hilbert space problem 160 are presented at the end of the paper.

entry.title: Existence of zeros for operators taking their values in the dual of a Banach space
entry.summary: We prove, under certain conditions, the existence of zeros for a weakly continuous operator on a paracompact topological space into the dual of a Banach space.

entry.title: A note on non-amenability of B(\ell_p) for p=1,2
entry.summary: This is an expository note on non-amenabilty of the Banach algebra B(\ell_p) for p=1,2. These were proved respectively by Connes (p=2) and Read (p=1) via very different methods. We give a single proof which reproves both.

entry.title: Asymptotics for Toeplitz determinants on a circular arc
entry.summary: An asymptotic formula is found for a Toeplitz determinant with the symbol supported on an arc of the unit circle in the case when the symbol has Fisher-Hartwig singularities.

entry.title: Nonstandard Analysis and Generalized Functions
entry.summary: This application of nonstandard analysis utilizes the notion of the highly-staturated enlargement. These nonstandard methods clarify many aspects of the theory of generalized functions (distributions).

entry.title: Integrable Operators and Canonical Differential Systems
entry.summary: In this article we consider a class of integrable operators and investigate its connections with the following theories:the spectral theory of non-self-adjoint operators, the Riemann-Hilbert problem, the canonical differential systems and the random matrices theory.

entry.title: On Regularity of the Product of Distributions
entry.summary: This paper has been withdrawn by the author due to a gap in the proof of the main result.

entry.title: Random processes via the combinatorial dimension: introductory notes
entry.summary: This is an informal discussion on one of the basic problems in the theory of empirical processes, addressed in our preprint "Combinatorics of random processes and sections of convex bodies", which is available at ArXiV and from our web pages.

entry.title: The index of singular integral operators with discontinuous oscillating coefficients
entry.summary: The article presents the procedure of the index calculation for the elements of the algebra generated by one dimensional singular integral operators with discontinuous oscillating coefficients.

entry.title: Fixed point theorems for asymptotically contractive mappings
entry.summary: In this short paper, we prove fixed point theorems for nonexpansive mappings whose domains are unbounded subsets of Banach spaces. These theorems are generalizations of Penot's result in [Proc. Amer. Math. Soc., 131 (2003), 2371--2377].

entry.title: Reverses of the Triangle Inequality in Inner Product Spaces
entry.summary: Some new reverses for the generalised triangle inequality in inner product spaces and applications are given. Applications in connection to the Schwarz inequality are provided as well.

entry.title: Some Reverses of the Generalised Triangle Inequality in Complex Inner Product Spaces
entry.summary: Some reverses for the generalised triangle inequality in complex inner product spaces that improve the classical Diaz-Metcalf results and applications are given.

entry.title: Reverses of the Continuous Triangle Inequality for Bochner Integral of Vector-Valued Functions in Hilbert Spaces
entry.summary: Some reverses of the continuous triangle inequality for Bochner integral of vector-valued functions in Hilbert spaces are given. Applications for complex-valued functions are provided as well.

entry.title: Quadratic Reverses of the Continuous Triangle Inequality for Bochner Integral of Vector-Valued Functions in Hilbert Spaces
entry.summary: Some quadratic reverses of the continuous triangle inequality for Bochner integral of vector-valued functions in Hilbert spaces are given. Applications for complex-valued functions are provided as well.

entry.title: Additive Reverses of the Continuous Triangle Inequality for Bochner Integral of Vector-Valued Functions in Hilbert Spaces
entry.summary: Some additive reverses of the continuous triangle inequality for Bochner integral of vector-valued functions in Hilbert spaces are given. Applications for complex-valued functions are provided as well.

entry.title: Some Reverses of the Continuous Triangle Inequality for Bochner Integral of Vector-Valued Functions in Complex Hilbert Spaces
entry.summary: Some reverses of the continuous triangle inequality for Bochner integral of vector-valued functions in complex Hilbert spaces are given. Applications for complex-valued functions are provided as well.

entry.title: The set of common fixed points of an n-parameter continuous semigroup of mappings
entry.summary: In this paper, using Kronecker's theorem, we discuss the set of common fixed points of an n-parameter continuous semigroup of mappings. We also discuss convergence theorems to a common fixed point of an n-parameter nonexpansive semigroup.

entry.title: Fourier tranform in exponential rearrangement invariant spaces
entry.summary: In this article we investigate the Fourier series and transforms for the functions defined on the $ [0, 2 \pi]^ d $ or $ R^d $ and belonging to the exponential Orlicz and some other rearrangement invariant (r.i.) spaces.

entry.title: Topological structures in Colombeau algebras: investigation of the duals of $\Gc(\Om)$, $\G(\Om)$ and $\GS(\R^n)$
entry.summary: We study the topological duals of the Colombeau algebras $\Gc(\Om)$, $\G(\Om)$ and $\GS(\R^n)$, discussing some continuous embeddings and the properties of generalized delta functionals.

entry.title: Complementary Lagrangians in Infinite Dimensional Symplectic Hilbert Spaces
entry.summary: Using the Spectral Theorem for unbounded self-adjoint operators we prove that any countable family of Lagrangian subspaces of a symplectic Hilbert space admits a common complementary Lagrangian.

entry.title: Remarks on Naimark's duality
entry.summary: We present an extension of Naimark's duality principle which states that complete systems in a Hilbert space are projections of $\omega$-linearly independent systems of elements of an ambient Hilbert space. This result is presented in the context of other known extensions of Naimark's theorem.

entry.title: Contractibility of Maximal Ideal Spaces of Certain Algebras of Almost Periodic Functions
entry.summary: We study some topological properties of maximal ideal spaces of certain algebras of almost periodic functions. Our main result is that such spaces are contractible. We present certain corollaries of this result.

entry.title: Orthogonal polynomials in several non-commuting variables. II
entry.summary: In this paper we continue to investigate a certain class of Hankel-like positive definite kernels using their associated orthogonal polynomials. The main result of this paper is about the structure of this kind of kernels.

entry.title: Infinitely many local minima of sequentially weakly lower semicontinuous functionals
entry.summary: We give an overview of some applications of a general variational principle.
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: Nonlinear Analysis and Convex Analysis , W. Takahashi and T. Tanaka eds., 433-442, Yokohama Publishers, 2003

entry.title: On kernel theorems for Frechet and DF spaces
entry.summary: A convenient technique for calculating completed topological tensor products of functional Frechet or DF spaces is developed. The general construction is applied to proving kernel theorems for a wide class of spaces of smooth and entire analytic functions.

entry.title: Genearlizations of Precupanu's Inequality for Orthornormal Families of Vectors in Inner Product Spaces
entry.summary: Some genearlizations of Precupanu's inequality for orthornormal families of vectors in real or complex inner product spaces and applications related to Buzano's, Richard's and Kurepa's results are given

entry.title: Sharp Hardy type inequalities on the Carnot Group
entry.summary: In this paper we establish sharp weighted Hardy type inequalities on the Carnot group with homogeneous dimension $Q\ge 3$.

entry.title: Refinements of Reverse Triangle Inequalities in Inner Product Spaces
entry.summary: Refining some results of S. S. Dragomir, several new reverses of the triangle inequality in inner product spaces are obtained.
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: J. Inequal. Pure Appl. Math. 6(3) (2005), article 64, 12 pp.

entry.title: On the uniform convexity of L^p
entry.summary: We present a short, direct proof of the uniform convexity of L^p spaces for 1<p<\infty.
entry.arxiv:comment: V2: somewhat expanded to improve the exposition

entry.title: On Differences of Riesz Homomorphisms
entry.summary: An order bounded functional on a Riesz space is a difference of Riesz homomorphisms if and only if the kernel of this functional is a Riesz subspace of the ambient Riesz space.

entry.title: Beurling's Theorem and characterization of heat kernel for Riemannian Symmetric spaces of noncompact type
entry.summary: We prove Beurling's theorem for rank 1 Riemmanian symmetric spaces and relate it to the characterization of the heat kernel of the symmetric space.

entry.title: Advances on Inequalities of the Schwarz, Triangle and Heisenberg Type in Inner Product Spaces
entry.summary: The purpose of this survey is to give a comprehensive introduction to some classes of classical and recent analytic inequalities in Inner Product Spaces.

entry.title: Non-intersection bodies all of whose central sections are intersection bodies
entry.summary: We construct symmetric convex bodies that are not intersection bodies, but all of their central hyperplane sections are intersection bodies. This result extends the studies by Weil in the case of zonoids and by Neyman in the case of subspaces of $L_p$.

entry.title: The generalized Busemann-Petty problem with weights
entry.summary: The generalized Busemann-Petty problem asks whether origin-symmetric convex bodies with lower-dimensional smaller sections necessarily have smaller volume. We study the weighted version of this problem corresponding to the physical situation when bodies are endowed with mass distribution and the relevant sections are measured with attenuation.

entry.title: Triple homomorphisms of C*-algebras
entry.summary: In this note, we will discuss what kind of operators between C*-algebras preserves Jordan triple products {a,b,c}= (ab*c + cb*a)/2. These include especially isometries and disjointness preserving operators.

entry.title: Scaled Enflo type is equivalent to Rademacher type
entry.summary: We introduce the notion of scaled Enflo type of a metric space, and show that for Banach spaces, scaled Enflo type p is equivalent to Rademacher type p.

entry.title: A fundamental identity for Parseval frames
entry.summary: In this paper we establish a suprising fundamental identity for Parseval frames in a Hilbert space. Several variations of this result are given, including an extension to general frames. Finally, we discuss the derived results.

entry.title: Invertibility of random matrices: norm of the inverse
entry.summary: Let A be an n by n matrix, whose entries are independent copies of a centered random variable satisfying the subgaussian tail estimate. We prove that the operator norm of A^{-1} does not exceed Cn^{3/2} with probability close to 1.

entry.title: Real Paley-Wiener theorems for the Dunkl transform on Rd
entry.summary: In this paper, we establish real Paley-Wiener theorems for the Dunkl transform on Rd. More precisely, we characterize the functions in the Schwartz space S(IRd) and in L2k(Rd) whose Dunkl transform has bounded, unbounded, convex and nonconvex support.

entry.title: Bessel Type Inequalities for Non-Orthonormal Families of Vectors in Inner Product Spaces
entry.summary: Some sharp Bessel type inequalities for non-orthonormal families of vectors in inner product spaces are given. Applications for complex numbers are also provided.

entry.title: On Some Discrete Inequalities in Normed Linear Spaces
entry.summary: Some sharp discrete inequalities in normed linear spaces are obtained. New reverses of the generalised triangle inequality are also given.

entry.title: Some necessary and sufficient conditions for Hypercyclicity Criterion
entry.summary: We give necessary and sufficient conditions for an operator on a separable Hilbert space to satisfy the hypercyclicity criterion.
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: Proc. Indian Acad. Sci. (Math. Sci.), Vol. 115, No. 2, May 2005, pp. 209-216

entry.title: On the Structure of the Square of a C_0(1) Operator
entry.summary: WE use the structure theory for C_0 operators to determine when the square of a C_0(1) operator is irreducible and when its lattices of invariant and hyperinvariant subspaces coincide.

entry.title: Lattice structures and spreading models
entry.summary: We consider problems concerning the partial order structure of the set of spreading models of Banach spaces. We construct examples of spaces showing that the possible structure of these sets include certain classes of finite semi-lattices and countable lattices, and all finite lattices.

entry.title: Reverse Inequalities for the Numerical Radius of Linear Operators in Hilbert Spaces
entry.summary: Some elementary inequalities providing upper bounds for the difference of the norm and the numerical radius of a bounded linear operator on Hilbert spaces under appropriate conditions are given.

entry.title: Inequalities for the Norm and Numerical Radius of Composite Operators in Hilbert Spaces
entry.summary: Some new inequalities for the norm and the numerical radius of composite operators generated by a pair of operators are given.

entry.title: Kaczmarz algorithm in Hilbert space and tight frames
entry.summary: We prove that any tight frame in Hilbert space can be obtained by the Kaczmarz algorithm. An explicit way of constructing this correspondence is given. The uniqueness of the correspondence is determined.

entry.title: Weighted generalized inverses, oblique projections and least squares problems
entry.summary: A generalization with singular weights of Moore-Penrose generalized inverses of closed range operators in Hilbert spaces is studied using the notion of compatibility of subspaces and positive operators.

entry.title: Separated sequences in uniformly convex Banach spaces
entry.summary: We prove that the unit sphere of every infinite-dimensional uniformly convex Banach space with modulus of convexity $\delta$ contains a $(1+\frac12\delta(\frac23))$-separated sequence.

entry.title: Commutators and Sobolev spaces
entry.summary: This paper was withdrawn by arXiv admin because it plagiarizes "Chen, Wen Gu(PRC-BIAP); Lu, Shan Zhen(PRC-BJN) The commutators of fractional integrals on Besov spaces. Acta Math. Sin. (Engl. Ser.) 20 (2004), no. 3, 405--414."

entry.title: Modular estimates in Orlicz spaces and Hammerstein operator equations
entry.summary: Certain inequalities between the values of the modular and the norm in the Orlicz spaces are established. These inequalities are applied then to the theory of solvability of nonlinear integral equations of Hammerstein type.

entry.title: The Strong Approximation Conjecture holds for amenable groups
entry.summary: We prove that the approximation conjecture of Luck holds for all amenable groups in the complex group algebra case. This result was previously proved by Dodziuk, Linnell, Mathai, Schick and Yates under the assumption that the group is torsion-free elementary amenable.

entry.title: Hypoelliptic Dunkl equations in the space of distributions on $R^d$
entry.summary: In this paper we define and study the Dunkl convolution product and the Dunkl transform on spaces of distributions on $ \mathbb{R}^d$. By using the main results obtained, we study the hypoelliptic Dunkl convolution equations in the space of distributions.

entry.title: Symmetric norms and reverse inequalities to Davis and Hansen-Pedersen characterizations of operator convexity
entry.summary: Some rearrangement inequalities for symmetric norms on matrices are given as well as related results for operator convex functions.

entry.title: The sum of two measurable functions
entry.summary: The paper describes two Borel-measurable functions from a measure space into a locally convex space such that the image measure for each function is Radon but their sum is not Borel-measurable.

entry.title: Riesz basis of exponentials for a union of cubes in R^{d}
entry.summary: We extend to several dimensions the result of K. Seip and Y.I. Lyubarskii that proves the existence of Riesz basis of exponentials for a finite union of intervals with equals lengths.

entry.title: Local approximations and intrinsic characterizations of spaces of smooth functions on regular subsets of $R^n$
entry.summary: We give an intrinsic characterization of the restrictions of Sobolev, Triebel-Lizorkin and Besov spaces to regular subsets of $R^n$ via sharp maximal functions and local approximations.

entry.title: Aspects of p-adic non-linear functional analysis
entry.summary: The article provides an introduction to infinite-dimensional differential calculus over topological fields and surveys some of its applications, notably in the areas of infinite-dimensional Lie groups and dynamical systems.

entry.title: Complex Equiangular Cyclic Frames and Erasures
entry.summary: We derive various interesting properties of complex equiangular cyclic frames for many pairs (n, k) using Gauss sums and number theory. We further use these results to study the random and burst errors of some special cases of complex equiangular cyclic (n, k) frames.

entry.title: Generalized cosine transforms and classes of star bodies
entry.summary: The spherical Radon transform on the unit sphere can be regarded as a member of the analytic family of suitably normalized generalized cosine transforms. We derive new formulas for these transforms and apply them to study classes of intersections bodies in convex geometry.

entry.title: Three open problems in analysis
entry.summary: Three open problems in analysis are formulated: 1. Injectivity of Radon transform 2. A uniqueness problem for an elliptic system of PDE 3. A problem in operator theory

entry.title: Some new moment rearrangement invariant spaces; theory and applications
entry.summary: In this article we introduce and investigate some new Banach spaces, so - called moment spaces, and consider applications to the Fourier series, singular integral operators, theory of martingales.

entry.title: Sofic groups and convolution operators
entry.summary: This paper has been withdrawn by the author. The conjecture follows from the finiteness of group von Neumann algebras.
entry.arxiv:comment: the paper is withdrawn by the author

entry.title: A Paley-Wiener theorem for the inverse Fourier transform on some homogeneous spaces
entry.summary: We formulate and prove a version of Paley-Wiener theorem for the inverse Fourier transform on non-compact Riemannian symmetric spaces and Heisenberg groups. The main ingredient in the proof is the Gutzmer's formula.

entry.title: Carathéodory functions in the Banach space setting
entry.summary: We prove representation theorems for Carath\'eodory functions in the setting of Banach spaces.

entry.title: Matrix multiplication operators on Banach function spaces
entry.summary: In this paper, we study the matrix multiplication operators on Banach function spaces and discuss their applications in semigroups for solving the abstract Cauchy problem.

entry.title: Linear relations in the Calkin algebra for composition operators
entry.summary: We consider this and related questions: When is a finite linear combination of composition operators, acting on the Hardy space or the standard weighted Bergman spaces on the unit disk, a compact operator?
entry.arxiv:comment: 36 pages; to appear in Transactions of the Amer. Math. Soc

entry.title: The Sum Theorem for Linear Maximal Monotone Operators
entry.summary: The goal of this article is to give a positive answer to Rockafellar's maximality of the sum conjecture in the linear multi-valued operator case.

entry.title: Asymptotics of the Airy-kernel determinant
entry.summary: The authors use Riemann-Hilbert methods to compute the constant that arises in the asymptotic behavior of the Airy-kernel determinant of random matrix theory.

entry.title: Embeddings for anisotropic Besov spaces
entry.summary: We prove embedding theorems for fully anisotropic Besov spaces. More concrete, inequalities between modulus of continuity in different metrics and of Sobolev type are obtained. Our goal is to get sharp estimates for some anisotropic cases previously unconsidered.

entry.title: A note on a non-linear Krein-Rutman theorem
entry.summary: In this note we will present an extension of the Krein-Rutman theorem for an abstract nonlinear, compact, positively 1-homogeneous, monotone non-decreasing operators on a Banach space and apply the result to many nonlinear elliptic partial differential operators.

entry.title: On calculation of eigenvalues of Sturm-Liouville problem with indefinite weight having self-similar primitive
entry.summary: A method of calculation of eigenvalues of the problem $-y''-\lambda\rho y=0$, $y(0)=y(1)=0$, where $\rho$ is a distribution having self-similar primitive $P\in L_2[0,1]$, is described.

entry.title: Quartically hyponormal weighted shifts need not be 3-hyponormal
entry.summary: We give the first example of a quartically hyponormal unilateral weighted shift which is not 3-hyponormal.

entry.title: Spectral calculations on locally convex vector spaces I
entry.summary: We develop a holomorphic functional calculus for (multivalued linear) operators on locally convex vector spaces. This includes the case of fractional powers along Lipschitz curves.

entry.title: Marcinkiewicz-Zygmund inequalities and interpolation by spherical harmonics
entry.summary: We find necessary density conditions for Marcinkiewicz-Zygmund inequalities and interpolation for spaces of spherical harmonics with respect to the L^p norm. Moreover, we prove that there are no complete interpolation families for p\neq 2.

entry.title: Pointwise characterizations of Hardy-Sobolev functions
entry.summary: We establish simple pointwise characterizations of functions in the Hardy-Sobolev spaces within the range n/(n+1)

entry.title: A Shift Operator on L(H^2)
entry.summary: We give definitions and some properties of the shift operator S_{L(H^2)} and multiplication operator on L(H^2). In addition, we obtain some properties of the commutant of the shift operator S_{L(H^2)} and characterize S_{L(H^2)}-invariant subspaces.

entry.title: Integral operators induced by the Fock kernel
entry.summary: We study the $L^p$ boundedness and find the norm of a class of integral operators induced by the reproducing kernel of Fock spaces over $C^n$.

entry.title: Morse-Sard theorem for d.c. curves
entry.summary: Let $f:I\to X$ be a d.c. mapping, where $I\subset \R$ is an open interval and $X$ a Banach space. Let $C_f$ be the set of critical points of $f$. We prove that $f(C_f)$ has zero 1/2-dimensional Hausdorff measure.

entry.title: Multipliers and Toeplitz operators on Banach spaces of sequences
entry.summary: We prove that every multiplier M (bounded operator commuting with the shift operator) on a large class of Banach spaces of sequences on Z is associated to a function essentially bounded by the norm of M on the spectrum of S.

entry.title: Beurling's Theorem for $SL(2,\R)$
entry.summary: We prove Beurling's theorem for the full group $SL(2,\R)$. This is the {\em master theorem} in the quantitative uncertainty principle as all the other theorems of this genre follow from it.

entry.title: Riemann Rearrangement Theorem for some types of convergence
entry.summary: We reexamine the Riemann Rearrangement Theorem for different types of convergence. We consider series convergence with respect to a filter. We describe the Sum Range (SR) of a series along the 2n-filter and for statistically convergent series.

entry.title: Upper Semilattices of Finite-Dimensional Gauges
entry.summary: This is a brief overview of some applications of the ideas of abstract convexity to the upper semilattices of gauges in finite dimensions.

entry.title: The paving conjecture is equivalent to the paving conjecture for triangular matrices
entry.summary: We resolve a 25 year old problem by showing that The Paving Conjecture is equivalent to The Paving Conjecture for Triangular Matrices.

entry.title: Projections and the Kadison-Singer Problem
entry.summary: We prove some new equivalences of the paving conjecture and obtain some estimates on the paving constants. In addition we give a new family of counterexamples to one of the Akemann-Anderson conjectures.

entry.title: A note on $l^2$ norms of weighted mean matrices
entry.summary: We give a proof of Cartlidge's result on the $l^{p}$ operator norms of weighted mean matrices for $p=2$ on interpreting the norms as eigenvalues of certain matrices.

entry.title: A counterexample for boundedness of pseudo-differential operators on modulation spaces
entry.summary: We prove that pseudo-differential operators with symbols in the class $S_{1,\delta}^0$ ($0<\delta<1$) are not always bounded on the modulation space $M^{p,q}$ ($q\neq2$).

entry.title: A Representation Theorem for Completely Contractive Dual Banach Algebras
entry.summary: In this paper, we prove that every completely contractive dual Banach algebra is completely isometric to a $w^\ast$-closed subalgebra the operator space of completely bounded linear operators on some reflexive operator space.

entry.title: On a Calderon-Zygmund commutator-type estimate
entry.summary: In this paper we extend a Calderon-Zygmund commutator-type estimate. This estimate enables us to prove an embedding result concerning weighted function spaces.

entry.title: Taylor spectrum and characteristic functions of commuting 2-contractions
entry.summary: In this work, we give a description of Taylor spectrum of commuting 2- contractions in terms of characteristic functions of such contractions.The case of a single obtained by B.Sz.Nagy and C. Foias is generalised in this work.

entry.title: Revisiting Schur's bound on the largest singular value
entry.summary: We give upper and lower bounds on the largest singular value of a matrix using analogues to walks in graphs. For nonnegative matrices these bounds are asymptotically tight. In particular, we improve a bound due to I. Schur.

entry.title: Inversion Theorem for Bilinear Hilbert Transform
entry.summary: An approximation result for the bilinear Hilbert transform is proved and used for the inversion of the bilinear Hilbert transform. Also, p-Lebesgue points $(p\geq 1)$ are analyzed.

entry.title: Spectral flow as winding number and integral formulas
entry.summary: A general integral formula for the spectral flow of a path of unbounded selfadjoint Fredholm operators subject to certain summability conditions is derived from the interpretation of the spectral flow as a winding number.

entry.title: From the Brunn-Minkowski inequality to a class of Poincaré type inequalities
entry.summary: We present an argument which leads from the Brunn-Minkowski inequality to a Poincare' type inequality on the boundary of convex bodies with smooth boundary and positive Gauss curvature

entry.title: La formule de Lie-Trotter pour les semi-groupes fortement continus
entry.summary: In this research project we presents the general properties, the spectral properties and the representation formulas for $C_0$-semigroups of linear operators in Banach spaces
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: Memoire de recherche no.8/2003, l'Institut Girard Desargues, CNRS UMR5028, Lyon (05/2003)

entry.title: Weak type radial convolution operators on free group
entry.summary: Radial convolution operators on free groups with nonnegative kernel of weak type $(2,2)$ and of restricted weak type $(2,2)$ are characterized. Estimates of weak type $(p,p)$ are obtained as well for $1<p<2.$

entry.title: On the structure of positive maps between matrix algebras
entry.summary: A partial description of the structure of positive unital maps $\phi: M_2(\bC) \to M_{n+1}(\bC)$ ($n\geq 2$) is given.

entry.title: Abstract Convexity and Cone-Vexing Abstractions
entry.summary: This talk is a write-up on some origins of abstract convexity and afew vexing limitations on the range of abstraction in convexity.
entry.arxiv:comment: A talk for the workshop "Idempotent and Tropical Mathematics and Problems of Mathematical Physics," Moscow, August 25-30, 2007

entry.title: New Generalization of Perturbed Ostrowski Type Inequalities and Applications
entry.summary: Generalizations of Ostrowski type inequality for functions of Lipschitzian type are established. Applications in numerical integration and cumulative distribution functions are also given.

entry.title: Fixed point theorem for discontinuous mappings on PN spaces
entry.summary: We present a study on strong t-continuity and measure of discontinuity on PN spaces. As an application, we prove a fixed point theorem for a self mapping on PN spaces by means of measure of discontinuity.

entry.title: On (g, φ)-contraction in fuzzy metric spaces
entry.summary: In this paper, we give a generalization of Hicks type contractions and Golet type contractions on fuzzy metric spaces. We prove some fixed point theorems for this new type contractions mappings on fuzzy metric spaces.

entry.title: Generalized Banach contraction in probabilistic metric/normed spaces
entry.summary: In this paper, we present the generalization of B-contraction and C-contraction due to Sehgal and Hicks respectively. We also study some properties of C-contraction in probabilistic metric space.

entry.title: A remark on fractional integrals on modulation spaces
entry.summary: In this paper, we give the necessary and sufficient conditions for the boundedness of fractional integral operators on the modulation spaces.

entry.title: On the $L^2$-boundedness of pseudo-differential operators and their commutators with symbols in $α$-modulation spaces
entry.summary: In this paper, we consider the $L^2$-boundedness of pseudo-differential operators with symbols in $\alpha$-modulation spaces.

entry.title: Internal sets and internal functions in Colombeau theory
entry.summary: Inspired by nonstandard analysis, we define and study internal subsets and internal functions in algebras of Colombeau generalized functions. We prove a saturation principle for internal sets and provide applications to Colombeau algebras.

entry.title: Strong convergence of modified Ishikawa iterations for nonlinear mappings
entry.summary: In this paper, we prove a strong convergence theorem of modified Ishikawa iterations for relatively asymptotically nonexpansive mappings in Banach space. Our results extend and improve the recent results by Nakajo, Takahashi, Kim, Xu, Matsushita and some others.

entry.title: Some further remarks on good sets
entry.summary: We show that in n-fold cartesian product, n >= 4, a related component need not be a full component. We also prove that when n >= 4, uniform boundedness of lengths of geodesics is not a necessary condition for boundedness of solutions of (1) for bounded function f.

entry.title: Isometries for the Caratheodory Metric
entry.summary: Under certain hypothesises, we prove that a map which is an isometry for the Caratheodory infinitesimal metric at a point is an analytic isomorphism onto its image.

entry.title: The complex Busemann-Petty problem on sections of convex bodies
entry.summary: The complex Busemann-Petty problem asks whether origin symmetric convex bodies in $\C^n$ with smaller central hyperplane sections necessarily have smaller volume. We prove that the answer is affirmative if $n\le 3$ and negative if $n\ge 4.$

entry.title: On Dissipative Quadratic Stochastic Operators
entry.summary: In present paper we introduce the notion of dissipative quadratic stochastic operator and cubic stochastic operator. We prove necessary conditions for dissipativity of quadratic stochastic operators. Besides, it is studied certain limit behavior of such operators. Finally we prove ergodic theorem for dissipative operators.

entry.title: Quasi-Nilpotent Operators on Locally Convex Spaces
entry.summary: In this article we extend the notion of quasi-nilpotent equivalent operators, introduced by Colojoara and Foias \cite{co1} for Banach spaces, to the class of bounded operators on sequentially complete locally convex spaces.

entry.title: A general learning algorithm for functions between metric spaces
entry.summary: In this paper we show how to approximate ("learn") a function f, where X and Y are metric spaces.

entry.title: Trace ideals for pseudo-differential operators and their commutators with symbols in $α$-modulation spaces
entry.summary: In this paper, we consider the trace property of pseudo-differential operators with symbols in $\alpha$-modulation spaces.

entry.title: A theorem about three quadratic forms
entry.summary: We prove a self-improvement property regarding quadratic forms on arbitrary vector spaces. We discuss several consequences of this result, in particular those concerning dimension-free L^p estimates of certain singular integral operators (Riesz transforms).

entry.title: Some new characterizations of Banach spaces containing $\ell^1$
entry.summary: Several new characterizations of Banach spaces containing a subspace isomorphic to $\ell^1$, are obtained. These are applied to the question of when $\ell^1$ embeds in the injective tensor product of two Banach spaces.

entry.title: Quasi-Sectorial Contractions
entry.summary: We revise the notion of the quasi-sectorial contractions. Our main theorem establishes a relation between semigroups of quasi-sectorial contractions and a class of m-sectorial generators. We discuss a relevance of this kind of contractions to the theory of operator-norm approximations of strongly continuous semigroups.

entry.title: A Short Note on some open problems in the geometry of operator ideals
entry.summary: We list and discuss the background of some open problems, regarding the principle of local reflexivity for maximal Banach ideals.

entry.title: A Realization of Measurable Sets as Limit Points
entry.summary: Starting with a sigma finite measure on an algebra, we define a pseudometric and show how measurable sets from the Caratheodory Extension Theorem can be thought of as limit points of Cauchy sequences in the algebra.

entry.title: The kernel and continuity ideals of homomorphisms from C_0(Ω)
entry.summary: We give a description of the continuity ideals and the kernels of homomorphisms from the algebras of continuous functions on locally compact spaces into Banach algebras.

entry.title: Biflatness and Pseudo-Amenability of Segal algebras
entry.summary: We investigate generalized amenability and biflatness properties of various (operator) Segal algebras in both the group algebra, L1(G), and the Fourier algebra, A(G), of a locally compact group, G.

entry.title: A Note on the class of superreflexive almost transitive Banach spaces
entry.summary: The class J of simultaneously almost transitive, uniformly convex and uniformly smooth Banach spaces is characterized in terms of convex-transitivity and weak geometry of the norm.

entry.title: Continuous multilinear functionals on $C(K)$-spaces are integral
entry.summary: This paper has been withdrawn by the authors, due to a crucial error.

entry.title: Tensor, Sobolev, Multiplicative and Convolution Operators in the Bide - Side Grand Lebesque Spaces
entry.summary: In this paper we study the multiplicative, tensor, Sobolev's and convolution inequalities in certain Banach spaces, the so-called Bide - Side Grand Lebesque Spaces, and give examples to show their sharpness.

entry.title: Finite rank Bergman-Toeplitz and Bargmann-Toeplitz operators in many dimensions
entry.summary: The recent theorem by D. Luecking that finite rank Toeplitz-Bergman operators must be generated by a measure consisting of finitely many point masses is carried over to the many-dimensional case.

entry.title: On $l^2$ norms of some weighted mean matrices
entry.summary: We give another proof of a result of Bennett on the $l^{p}$ operator norms of some weighted mean matrices for the case $p=2$ and we also present some related results.

entry.title: Function Theory in Real Hardy Spaces
entry.summary: We show that many classical results in Hardy space theory have exact analogues when the Fourier coefficients are allowed only to be real.

entry.title: Invariant Krein subspaces, regular irreducibility and integral representations
entry.summary: We study unitary representations of groups in Krein spaces, irreducibility criteria and integral decompositions. Our main tool is the theory of Krein subspaces and their (reproducing) kernels and a variant of Choquet's theorem.

entry.title: Nikol'skii-type inequalities for rearrangement invariant spaces
entry.summary: In this paper we generalize the classical Nikol'skii inequality on the many popular classes pairs of rearrangement invariant (r.i.) spaces and construct some examples in order to show the exactness of our estimations.

entry.title: Four Properties of Reproducing Kernel Hilbert Spaces
entry.summary: A reproducing kernel Hilbert space (RKHS) has four well-known easily derived properties. Since these properties are usually not emphasized as a simple means of gaining insight into RKHS structure, they are singled out and proved in this brief article.

entry.title: Functional inequalities derived from the Brunn-Minkowski inequalities for quermassintegrals
entry.summary: We use Brunn-Minkowski inequalities for quermassintegrals to deduce a family of inequalities of Poincar\'e type on the unit sphere and on the boundary of smooth convex bodies in the $n$-dimensional Euclidean space.

entry.title: On the weak analogue of the Trotter-Kato theorem
entry.summary: In the Trotter-Kato approximation theorem for C_0-semigroups on Banach spaces, we replace the strong by the weak operator topology and discuss the validity of the relevant implications.

entry.title: On isoperimetric inequalities for log-convex measures
entry.summary: This paper has been withdrawn by the author

entry.title: Finite Rank Toeplitz Operators: Some Extensions of D.Luecking's Theorem
entry.summary: The recent theorem by D.Luecking about finite rank Bergman-Toeplitz operators is extended to weights being distributions with compact support and to the spaces of harmonic functions.

entry.title: Simultaneous realization of function space structures in transitive Banach spaces
entry.summary: This paper has been withdrawn, since it contains a corollary with impossible consequences and the source of an error is currently unknown.

entry.title: Symmetrization and sharp Sobolev inequalities in metric spaces
entry.summary: We derive sharp Sobolev inequalities for Sobolev spaces on metric spaces. In particular, we obtain new sharp Sobolev embeddings and Faber-Krahn estimates for H\"{o}rmander vector fields.

entry.title: A new approach to the Ramsey-type games and the Gowers dichotomy in F-spaces
entry.summary: We give a new approach to the Ramsey-type results of Gowers on block bases in Banach spaces and apply our results to prove the Gowers dichotomy in F-spaces.

entry.title: Sobolev $W^1_p$-spaces on closed subsets of $R^n$
entry.summary: For each $p>n$ we use local oscillations and doubling measures to give intrinsic characterizations of the restriction of the Sobolev space $W_p^1(R^n)$ to an arbitrary closed subset of $R^n$.

entry.title: A Theorem of Beurling and Hörmander on Damek-Ricci Spaces
entry.summary: This paper has been withdrawn by the authors, due to the requirement of the Journal where a modified version will be published.

entry.title: Some properties of generalized higher-order convexity
entry.summary: The generalized divided differences are introduced. They are applied to investigate some properties characterizing generalized higher-order convexity. Among others some support-type property is proved.

entry.title: About the asymptotic formula for spectral function of the Laplace-Beltrami operator on sphere
entry.summary: In this work we established asymptotical behavior for Riesz means of the spectral function of the Laplace operator on unit sphere.

entry.title: On positivity in algebras of tempered generalized functions
entry.summary: An explicit counterexample shows that contrary to the situation in the special Colombeau algebra, positivity and invertibility cannot be characterized pointwise in algebras of tempered generalized functions. Further a point value characterization of the latter is refined.

entry.title: Integration with Functions of a Quaternionic Variable
entry.summary: Recent innovations in the differential calculus for functions of non-commuting variables, beginning with a quaternionic variable, are now extended to consider some integration.
entry.arxiv:comment: 5 pages; added another proof in Section 2 and also a new Appendix
